item.title: 据天空新闻报道，英国 NCC 集团考虑出售网络安全部门
item.description: 据天空新闻周三援引消息人士的话报道，总部位于英国的全球网络安全专家 NCC 集团已开始进行战略审查，可能会出售其主要的网络安全部门。【原文：UK-based global cybersecurity specialist NCC Group has begun a strategic review that could entail a sale of its primary cybersecurity division, Sky News reported on Wednesday, citing sources.】

item.title: 特朗普提高关税后，巴西敦促与美国进行贸易谈判
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普宣布自8月起对巴西商品征收50%的关税后，巴西周三敦促美国对其5月提交的贸易提案作出回应，重申巴西对达成一项 "双方都能接受的 "协议持开放态度。【原文：Brazil on Wednesday urged the U.S. to respond to a trade proposal submitted in May, reaffirming its openness to a "mutually acceptable" deal after U.S. President Donald Trump announced a 50% tariff on Brazilian goods starting in August.】

item.title: 在全球范围内对涉嫌与俄罗斯有关联的黑客发出七张逮捕令
item.description: 德国和西班牙对一个亲俄黑客组织的七名嫌疑成员发出逮捕令，该组织被指控对关键基础设施、军火制造商、电力公司和公共当局实施网络攻击。【原文：Germany and Spain issued arrest warrants for seven suspected members of a pro-Russian hacking group accused of carrying out cyber attacks against critical infrastructure, arms makers, power companies and public authorities.】

item.title: 卡尼称美国尚未达成对加拿大有利的协议
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）周三表示，解决与软木木材相关的问题是正在进行的与美国贸易谈判的重中之重，但一项有利于加拿大工人的协议尚未摆上桌面。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Wednesday said working through issues related to softwood lumber is a top priority in ongoing trade negotiations with the U.S., but a deal that works for Canadian workers isn't yet on the table.】

item.title: Trendyol、Baykar 首席执行官、ADQ 和蚂蚁国际将在土耳其开发金融科技平台
item.description: 土耳其 Trendyol 集团、Baykar 首席执行官 Haluk Bayraktar、阿布扎比主权基金 ADQ 和蚂蚁金服国际公司周三表示，已同意探讨在土耳其成立一家提供数字金融服务的潜在金融科技合资企业。【原文：Turkey's Trendyol Group, Baykar CEO Haluk Bayraktar, Abu Dhabi’s sovereign fund ADQ and Ant International have agreed to explore a potential joint fintech venture offering digital financial services in Turkey, the companies said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局不考虑用马斯克的 "星链 "取代 L3Harris 和 Verizon 的合同
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局告诉立法者，它不考虑用埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 SpaceX 公司的 Starlink 卫星部门取代目前与 L3Harris 或 Verizon Communications 公司签订的电信合同。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration told lawmakers it is not considering replacing its current telecommunication contracts it holds with L3Harris or Verizon Communications with Elon Musk's SpaceX's Starlink satellite unit.】

item.title: Reddit 在 Downdetector 报告全球大面积故障后调查错误原因
item.description: 在 Downdetector.com 显示全球有超过 10 万用户报告了社交媒体平台的问题后，社交媒体平台 Reddit 表示正在调查错误率升高的问题。【原文：Social media platform Reddit said it was looking into elevated error rates, after Downdetector.com showed more than 100,000 users globally had reported issues with the social media platform.】

item.title: 美国贸易部长格里尔表示希望美国贸易逆差走下坡路
item.description: 美国贸易代表贾米森-格里尔（Jamieson Greer）周三表示，他的贸易政策目标是使美国1.2万亿美元的贸易逆差走上下降通道，并阻止美国先进制造业能力的流失。【原文：U.S. Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said on Wednesday that his trade policy goal was to put the $1.2 trillion U.S. trade deficit on a downward path and to stem the loss of U.S. advanced manufacturing capacity.】

item.title: 消息人士称，特朗普对解雇美联储主席鲍威尔持开放态度
item.description: 一位消息人士周三告诉路透社，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔持开放态度。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is open to the idea of firing Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, a source told Reuters on Wednesday.】

item.title: 特朗普将解雇美联储主席鲍威尔的报道引发美元和国债价格暴跌
item.description: 彭博社援引一位不愿透露姓名的白宫官员的话报道称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普很可能很快解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔，此后美元周三大幅下跌。【原文：The dollar fell sharply on Wednesday after Bloomberg, citing an unidentified White House official, reported U.S. President Donald Trump is likely to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell soon.】

item.title: 交易员加大对美联储降息的押注
item.description: 据报道，唐纳德-特朗普总统可能很快解雇美联储杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell），交易商目前押注从9月开始降息，到12月至少再降息一次，此后美国短期利率期货周三上涨。【原文：Short-term U.S. interest-rate futures rose on Wednesday after a report that President Donald Trump is likely to fire Federal Reserve Jerome Powell soon, with traders now betting on rate cuts starting in September and at least one more by December.】

item.title: 加拿大宣布对进口钢铁征收新关税以保护国内产业
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）周三表示，加拿大将对与之签订自由贸易协定的国家（美国除外）实行关税配额，以保护国内钢铁行业。加拿大还将在 7 月底前对从所有非美国国家进口的含有在中国熔化和浇铸的钢材的钢材征收 25% 的额外关税。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney on Wednesday said that Canada will introduce a tariff rate quota for countries with which it has free trade agreements, excluding the United States, to protect the domestic steel industry. Canada will also implement additional tariffs of 25% on steel imports from all non-U.S. countries containing steel melted and poured in China before the end of July.】

item.title: 前英国国家犯罪署官员因从暗网毒贩处窃取比特币而入狱
item.description: 英国国家犯罪署的一名官员从非法暗网市场的经营者那里窃取了加密货币，周三被判处 5-1 年半监禁。【原文：An officer with Britain's National Crime Agency who stole cryptocurrency from the operator of an illegal dark web marketplace was jailed on Wednesday for 5-1/2 years.】

item.title: 特朗普发出关税威胁后，墨西哥计划加强与加拿大的贸易合作
item.description: 墨西哥总统克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆周三表示，她已与加拿大总理马克-卡尼进行了交谈，双方同意加强贸易合作，特别是考虑到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将于8月1日开始征收关税。【原文：Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Wednesday that she had spoken with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney and that the two had agreed to strengthen trade collaboration, particularly in light of the tariffs from U.S. President Donald Trump set to go in effect on August 1.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，XAI 正在讨论在沙特阿拉伯租赁数据中心容量的事宜
item.description: 据彭博新闻社（Bloomberg News）周三报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的xAI公司正在沙特阿拉伯洽谈租赁数据中心的事宜，这是该公司在提供廉价能源和政治善意的地区扩大基础设施的努力的一部分。【原文：Elon Musk's xAI is in talks to lease data center capacity in Saudi Arabia, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday, as part of an effort to expand its infrastructure in regions offering cheap energy and political goodwill.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，OpenAI 正在开发 ChatGPT 内的支付结账系统
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周三援引多位熟悉该计划的人士的话报道称，OpenAI 正计划通过在聊天机器人中集成支付结账系统，从通过 ChatGPT 进行的在线产品销售中分一杯羹。【原文：OpenAI is planning to take a cut from online product sales made through ChatGPT by integrating a payment checkout system into the chatbot, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing multiple people familiar with the proposals.】

item.title: 法国削减公共假期的计划可能无助于经济发展
item.description: 法国政府认为，为了自身利益，法国有太多的休息日，但其削减部分公共假日的提议可能不会产生太大的经济效益。【原文：The French government thinks the country has too many days off for its own good, but its proposal to cull some public holidays may not produce much of an economic benefit.】

item.title: 彭博社报道：特朗普可能很快解雇美联储主席鲍威尔
item.description: 彭博社周三援引一位不愿透露姓名的白宫官员的话报道称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普很可能很快解雇美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump is likely to fire Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell soon, Bloomberg reported on Wednesday, citing an unidentified White House official.】

item.title: 美国银行有望推出稳定币，摩根士丹利也在考虑使用稳定币
item.description: 美国银行首席执行官布莱恩-莫伊尼汉（Brian Moynihan）周三表示，美国银行与业内其他公司一样，一直在研究稳定币，投资者可以期待该银行在这方面取得进展，但没有给出时间表。【原文：Bank of America has been working on stablecoins like the rest of the industry and investors can expect the lender to move forward on this, CEO Brian Moynihan said on Wednesday, without giving a timeline.】

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩称新预算适合 "新时代
item.description: 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）周三宣布，她提出的 2028-2034 年欧盟 2 万亿欧元新预算是为新时代设计的"。【原文：European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen declared on Wednesday that her proposed new 2 trillion euro budget for the European Union from 2028-2034 had been designed for a new era".】

item.title: 美国 6 月制造业产出略有增长
item.description: 尽管制造业仍然受到进口关税的制约，但由于汽车产量的下降被其他方面的增长所抵消，美国 6 月份的工厂生产略有增长。【原文：U.S. factory production edged up in June as a decline in motor vehicle output was offset by gains elsewhere, though manufacturing remains constrained by tariffs on imports.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利评估收购，但首席执行官称交易标准较高
item.description: 摩根士丹利首席执行官泰德-皮克（Ted Pick）是华尔街最大的交易商之一，他表示，自己的公司正在考虑收购，并将为收购设定一个高标准。【原文：Morgan Stanley CEO Ted Pick, who runs one of Wall Street's biggest dealmakers, said his own firm was considering acquisitions and would set a high bar for purchases.】

item.title: 个人保险增长强劲，Progressive 利润翻了一番多
item.description: Progressive 公司周三公布的第二季度财报显示，受个人保险业务强劲表现的提振，该公司第二季度利润增长了一倍多，股价因此上涨了 1.5%。【原文：Progressive Corp reported second-quarter profit that more than doubled on Wednesday, boosted by robust performance in its personal lines insurance business, sending its shares up 1.5%.】

item.title: 巴林将在特朗普会谈期间宣布 170 亿美元的美国交易
item.description: 一位白宫官员说，巴林王储将在周三与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的会晤中宣布在美国投资超过 170 亿美元的计划。【原文：Bahrain's crown prince is set to announce plans to invest more than $17 billion in the United States during a meeting with President Donald Trump on Wednesday, a White House official said.】

item.title: 赛默飞收购赛诺菲新泽西生产基地
item.description: 赛默飞世尔周三表示，将收购赛诺菲位于新泽西州里奇菲尔德的生产基地，为这家法国制药商生产关键药品。【原文：Thermo Fisher said on Wednesday it will buy Sanofi's manufacturing site in Ridgefield, New Jersey, to produce critical medicines for the French drugmaker.】

item.title: 不列颠哥伦比亚省省长告诉彭博新闻社：加拿大正在权衡限制美国木材出口以缓解贸易摩擦
item.description: 加拿大不列颠哥伦比亚省省长大卫-艾比（David Eby）在周三发表的一篇报道中告诉彭博新闻社，加拿大愿意考虑限制对美国的软木木材出口，以试图缓解邻国之间的一些贸易摩擦。【原文：Canada is open to considering limits on softwood lumber exports to the U.S. to try to ease some trade friction between the neighboring countries, British Columbia Premier David Eby told Bloomberg News in a report published on Wednesday.】

item.title: 微软和美国国家实验室利用人工智能加快核电审批流程
item.description: 微软公司和美国一家国家实验室周三表示，他们正在合作研究如何利用人工智能来加快编制新核电站许可证所需文件的过程。【原文：Microsoft and a U.S. national laboratory on Wednesday said they are partnering to examine how artificial intelligence could be used to speed up the process of compiling the documents needed to secure permits for new nuclear power plants.】

item.title: 德国财政部长：特朗普关税对美国经济的威胁不亚于对欧洲经济的威胁
item.description: 德国财政部长拉尔斯-克林拜尔（Lars Klingbeil）周三表示，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税对美国经济的威胁至少与对欧洲经济的威胁一样大，他呼吁与美国人达成 "公平交易"。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs threaten the American economy at least as much the European one, German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil said on Wednesday, calling for a "fair deal" with the Americans.】

item.title: 中国誓言规范电动车行业的 "非理性 "竞争
item.description: 据中国中央电视台（CCTV）报道，中国内阁周三承诺对中国电动汽车行业所谓的 "非理性 "竞争进行监管，并誓言加强成本调查和价格监控。【原文：China's cabinet on Wednesday pledged to regulate what it called "irrational" competition in the country's electric vehicle industry, vowing to strengthen cost investigation and price monitoring, according to state broadcaster CCTV.】

item.title: 美国 6 月生产者价格保持不变
item.description: 由于服务业的疲软抵消了进口关税导致的商品成本上升，6 月份美国生产者价格意外持平。【原文：U.S. producer prices were unexpectedly unchanged in June as an increase in the cost of goods because of tariffs on imports was offset by weakness in services.】
